name: Keely

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Took your sweet time. I suppose the NCR sent you?

topics.topic_text: We can talk later. Right now we need to get out of here.
topics.response_text: All right, all right. Just trying to make a little conversation. Shoulda known a youngin like you would be in a hurry.

topics.topic_text: No, I was just exploring the vault when I stumbled on this place.
topics.response_text: Well that's a hell of a bit of luck on my part, then.

topics.topic_text: I was sent to fetch some research data. No one said anything about a rescue.
topics.response_text: Looks like you got sent on the same fool's errand I did, then.

topics.topic_text: Of course. I'd be glad to help.
topics.response_text: Good. Meet me on the second level, and I'll explain what needs to be done.

topics.topic_text: How much are you paying?
topics.response_text: So you're one of those, huh? Fine, I'll give you all the money I have once we're done. Meet me on the second level, and I'll explain more.

topics.topic_text: No deal. You'll have to do it without me.
topics.response_text: Have it your way. When you change your mind, I'll be on the second level. Meet me there and I'll explain what needs to be done.

topics.topic_text: Sure, how can I help?
topics.response_text: Time is of the essence, so I'll be brief. This place is filled with spores that are toxic to humans, and we need to get rid of them.

topics.topic_text: Just as long as I'm getting paid for this.
topics.response_text: You really have a one track mind, you know that? Anyway, listen up.

topics.topic_text: The hell I am. The door to the entrance is locked!
topics.response_text: Of course it is. This place is under quarantine until I finish what I started. Now listen up.

topics.topic_text: I told you. I'm not helping you.
topics.response_text: I don't think you understand the situation. Listen up.

topics.topic_text: Sounds dangerous, but I'll do it.
topics.response_text: Good. Return to me when it's done.

topics.topic_text: You're out of your mind.
topics.response_text: I'd love to debate you on this, but there's no time. Now do it or don't, but stop wasting my time.

topics.topic_text: Any idea where these vents are that I'm looking for?
topics.response_text: I set the gas to pump into the fifth level since that's where the concentration of spores was highest. I'd start looking there.

topics.topic_text: What needs to be done?
topics.response_text: I've managed to create a connection to the vault's backup system from here. I just have to remotely delete all the files, and we're done here.

topics.topic_text: Wait! Don't delete the files!
topics.response_text: What's got you so flustered? You just about scared me to death shouting like that.

topics.topic_text: I need those files. Dr. Hildern specifically sent me here to find them.
topics.response_text: Don't you realize what those files represent? If they get into the wrong hands, this could happen all over again.

topics.topic_text: If we destroy the files, all of these people will have died in vain.
topics.response_text: No, these people died trying to stop a monster of their own creation. Failing to complete their work would mean they died in vain.

topics.topic_text: Deleting those files makes it more likely that this will happen again.
topics.response_text: How do you figure that?

topics.topic_text: Science isn't just about success. Failures are just as important to learn from.
topics.response_text: I suppose the data here could serve as a warning to other scientists. Tell them what paths of research not to follow.

topics.topic_text: Exactly. Without that knowledge, something similar is bound to occur.
topics.response_text: All right. You convinced me. Take the files back to that buffoon. You make a good point, but I still honestly hope you know what you're doing.

topics.topic_text: Will it take long?
topics.response_text: No, it shouldn't take all that long. Just a few more moments and...

topics.topic_text: Actually, I copied the files. Hildern sent me here to get them.
topics.response_text: Yes, that sounds like something he'd do. Well, there's nothing for it, then.

topics.topic_text: I'm afraid I can't let you do that.
topics.response_text: So you're going to be stubborn about it, eh? You're sure I can't change your mind about this?

topics.topic_text: Positive.
topics.response_text: Then you give me no choice.

topics.topic_text: On second thought, go ahead and erase the data.
topics.response_text: Glad you're thinking clearly. I was afraid to blink there for a second.

topics.topic_text: Good riddance. Those files have caused enough trouble.
topics.response_text: Indeed. This should only take a minute. Just a few more moments and...

topics.topic_text: <Lie> No, I've been too busy rescuing you. Could someone else have done it?
topics.response_text: It's possible. I have spent the last few days in a cave, after all.

topics.topic_text: Never mind. Go ahead and delete the files.
topics.response_text: You're pretty highstrung for a youngster. In any case, just a few more moments and...

topics.topic_text: No, should they have?
topics.response_text: Well, if they had any manners they would. In my day, if an old lady went missing for a spell, people cared.

topics.topic_text: The scientists here must have made some useful discoveries.
topics.response_text: Oh, they did. I've taken extensive notes of all their successful experiments. Their research won't go to waste. As for the file erasure...

topics.topic_text: Yes, Angela Williams asked me to come find you.
topics.response_text: Ah, she's such a dear. Not like that pompous little pedant she works for.

topics.topic_text: No questions right now. I'll be going.
topics.response_text: Well in that case, leave me to my work.

topics.topic_text: How exactly should I ignite the gas?
topics.response_text: In the area where the gas is active, any kind of fire or explosion should do the trick. Hell, even lasers would do the job.

topics.topic_text: Did you say there'd be a blast?
topics.response_text: Oh yes, I imagine there'll be quite an explosion when the gas gets set off. Fire will probably expand throughout the entire level in mere moments.

topics.topic_text: How am I supposed to survive that?
topics.response_text: That does pose a problem, doesn't it?

topics.topic_text: Blast?
topics.response_text: Yes, there'll be an explosion when the gas is ignited. But I'm sure you'll be fine. Now leave me to my work.

topics.topic_text: Has your research here turned up anything interesting?
topics.response_text: A few things here and there, but a lot of the data has been corrupted, and all of the live samples have been contaminated by the spore plants.

topics.topic_text: And?
topics.response_text: What? Do I have to figure everything out for you? Fine, let me think for a second.

topics.topic_text: No way. I'm not going to torch myself for your amusement.
topics.response_text: It would be pretty funny, wouldn't it? Oh, don't look at me that way. I'm sure you'll be fine.

topics.topic_text: Where did these plants come from?
topics.response_text: From what I've been able to determine, the scientists here managed to breed them by combining traits from two distinct plant species.

topics.topic_text: How did you get this whole gas thing set up so quickly?
topics.response_text: That's a very good question! Actually, I didn't come up with it. The systems were already set up to pump the gas when I first arrived here.

topics.topic_text: What happened to the scientists, then?
topics.response_text: Something prevented them from igniting the gas, obviously. I suppose it's possible that the gas triggered some kind of defensive reaction.

topics.topic_text: What were you doing down in that cave?
topics.response_text: The mantises and spore plants virtually ignored me for most of the time that I've been here.

topics.topic_text: Why is the door to the entrance locked?
topics.response_text: Are you kidding me? This place is under quarantine! We can't let a single spore get out of this place if we can help it.

topics.topic_text: That data is valuable to me.
topics.response_text: What do you mean?

topics.topic_text: Do you know how many caps I can get for it?
topics.response_text: Ah, I should have known. Well, in that case...

topics.topic_text: In the right hands, it could do a lot of good. I'll see it gets there.
topics.response_text: I suppose you've given me no reason not to trust you. Fine, take the data and go. I hope you know what you're doing.

topics.topic_text: I did download some files earlier while exploring the vault.
topics.response_text: Those files need to be erased. Hold out your arm and I'll have it done in a flash.

topics.topic_text: Are these files valuable?
topics.response_text: To someone, I'm sure. But they constitute a threat to life as we know it. Now give me your arm already.

topics.topic_text: My friend is part of a group that can develop it into something safe everyone can benefit from.
topics.response_text: I suppose you've given me no reason not to trust you. Fine, take the data and go. I hope you know what you're doing.

description:
Keely is a 130 year-old N/A Female.

Keely is a pre-War ghoul and a talented botanist working for the New California Republic's Office of Science and Industry. Trapped in Vault 22 since the Great War, she continues her research on the unique flora that grows there despite the dangers.

Keely's Personality: Pragmatic, intelligent, and determined. Keely is driven by a desire to preserve knowledge that could benefit the wasteland while eliminating threats to human survival. She maintains a professional demeanor even in dire circumstances, prioritizing scientific progress above personal comfort.

Keely's Backstory: Born before the Great War, Keely was already a promising botanist when the world ended. She found refuge in Vault 22, where she continued her research on the vault's unique ecosystem. Over the decades, the vault's experiments with fungi and plants went awry, transforming the inhabitants into spore carriers and attracting dangerous mantises. Despite these dangers, Keely remained committed to her work, documenting every successful experiment while planning to destroy the hazardous plant colony that threatens the wasteland.
